link.script: $(document).ready(function() {var firstLoad = true;$('#datepicker').datepicker({prevText: ' ',nextText: ' ',onSelect: function(dateText, inst) {if (!firstLoad) {var selected_date = new Date(dateText);var additional_url = 'ff_month_year='+ (parseInt(selected_date.getMonth()) + 1) +'-' + selected_date.getFullYear() + '&ffDay=' + selected_date.getDate();var calendar_url = "http://redrockconference.org/g5-bin/client.cgi?G5genie=8&school_id=1&" + additional_url;window.open(calendar_url,'Calendar','location=1,status=1,scrollbars=yes, resizable=yes, width=650,height=550,top='+(screen.availHeight/2 - 300)+',left='+(screen.availWidth/2 - 300));}firstLoad = false; }});});

a.title: Adrian Title I Parent Involvement Plan.pdf

p.img: Welcome to ISD 511 better known as Adrian Public Schools. Adrian offers a small school setting and caring environment with a low student to teacher ratio. We are proud to offer a comprehensive and innovative academic program that includes; early childhood education, a strong K-5 elementary program, technologically advanced classrooms, up to date computer labs, college level courses, hands-on industrial arts, a fine arts program and foreign language. All of theses fit well with the foundational courses in English, math, reading, writing, science and social studies to make up a solid curriculum.

div.p: In addition to academics, we have a variety of extra curricular programs that boast wide participation and unprecedented success. Approximately 85% of our secondary students participate on athletic teams and in fine arts programs to round out their educational experience.

In the past 15 years District residents have passed bond issues that met the need for improved and up to date facilities. More recently, our voters have passed operating referendums to keep programs and staff in place. It goes without saying that community support has been essential to the mission of our school, which is to educate students.

Along with community support, we have a dedicated board of education that understands the issues and seeks to do what is best for our students. We have a professional staff of administrators, teachers and support personnel that work with our students to meet their educational needs.
I would invite you to take a moment to search this website for additional information about our school district.

div.br:
In accordance with Federal civil rights law and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) civil rights regulations and policies, the USDA, its Agencies, offices, and employees, and institutions participating in or administering USDA programs are prohibited from discriminating based on race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, or reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity in any program or activity conducted or funded by USDA. Persons with disabilities who require alternative means of communication for program information (e.g. Braille, large print, audiotape, American Sign Language, etc.), should contact the Agency (State or local) where they applied for benefits. Individuals who are deaf, hard of hearing or have speech disabilities may contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at (800) 877-8339. Additionally, program information may be made available in languages other than English. To file a program complaint of discrimination, complete the USDA Program Discrimination Complaint Form, (AD-3027) found online at: https://www.ascr.usda.gov/filing-discrimination-complaint-usda-customer, and at any USDA office, or write a letter addressed to USDA and provide in the letter all of the information requested in the form. To request a copy of the complaint form, call (866) 632-9992. Submit your completed form or letter to USDA by: (1) mail: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Office of the Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, 1400 Independence Avenue, SW, Washington, D.C. 20250-9410; (2) fax: (202) 690-7442; or (3) email: program.intake@usda.gov.
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
